General.description: General information about the game, its mechanics, and key elements.

HQ.definition: The main building in Boom Beach that you must protect and upgrade.

Boom Beach.definition: A game where you build a base and attack other bases.

resource base.definition: A special base in Boom Beach that contains resources you can collect and defend.

Support.description: Items and buildings that provide support during battles.

sentry.definition: A defensive building in Boom Beach that fires at enemy troops and vehicles.

medkit.definition: An item used to heal troops during battle.

landing craft.definition: A boat used to send in troops in battle.

Economy.description: Buildings and features related to resource management and trading.

resource base.definition: A special base in Boom Beach that contains resources you can collect and defend.

vault.definition: A building where you store your resources to protect them from raids.

trading post.definition: A building where you can trade resources with other players or the game.

Defences.description: Defensive buildings used to protect your base.

sniper tower.definition: The first defensive building you unlock in Boom Beach; basic and reliable.

flamethrower.definition: A defensive building that deals area-of-effect damage to enemy troops.

boom cannon.definition: A powerful defensive building that deals high damage to enemy troops and vehicles.

shock launcher.definition: A defensive building that temporarily disables enemy defenses with electrical shocks.

rocket launcher.definition: A defensive building that fires rockets, causing splash damage to enemy troops and vehicles.

lazor beam.definition: A prototype defence that fires a penetrative beam at troops, inflicting massive damage to grouped enemies in a line.

boom surprise.definition: A prototype defence that fires powerful shells at rapid succession at tanky troops, which is protected by an underground bunker until enemies get too close.

Troops.description: Different types of troops available in the game.

rifleman.definition: A basic infantry troop that is all-rounded.

heavy.definition: A bulky infantry troop that has high health and relatively short range to protect other troops behind them.

zooka.definition: A long-range troop that has very low health and inflicts high damage at a distance.

medic.definition: A support troop that heals other troops with his medkits.

Battle.description: Items and strategies used during battles.

medkit.definition: An item used to heal troops during battle.

flares.definition: A tactical item used to direct troops to a specific location during battle.

smoke screen.definition: An item that hides troops from enemy defenses for a short period.

crystal shield projector.definition: A temporary gunboat ability that provides powerful defensive shields to all affected troops.

Events.description: Special events and challenges in Boom Beach.

Warships.definition: A special event in Boom Beach where players use Warships to battle others.

Mega Crab.definition: A recurring event where players fight a massive crab boss with increasing difficulty.

Dr. T.definition: A recurring event where players battle Dr. Terror and his bases.

Slang.description: Common phrases and terms used by the community.

boom surprise.definition: A powerful, vigorous, forceful or robust person or thing.
boom surprise.origin: Originated from the prototype defence in Boom Beach

attack that boom cannon.definition: (often used with an object) take order aggressively.
attack that boom cannon.origin: Derived from a popular commercial, often used and respected humorously in the community.

Miscellaneous.description: Other terms and concepts not covered in other categories.

scout.definition: A type of reconnaissance unit used to gather information.

prototype defence.definition: Advanced defensive buildings with unique abilities, often available during special events.
